intro: Catha parvifolius, commonly known as African khat, is a shrub native to the Horn of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species in its native habitat.
